intro: Vigna hirta, commonly known as cowpea or *Pigweed*, is an annual leguminous plant native to Africa. It is characterized by its hairy stems and trifoliate leaves, with each leaflet being ovate to lanceolate in shape. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that develop into elongated, cylindrical pods containing 8–12 seeds. Vigna hirta is known for its adaptability to various soil types and its ability to fix atmospheric nitrogen, making it a valuable crop in sustainable agriculture. It is widely cultivated for its edible seeds, which are rich in protein and used in many cuisines around the world.
